questions.question: Analyze the code below: if (counter === 10) {console.log('abc');}. How can we write the same condition using the switch statement?

answers.option: Yo can call window methods, such as winwow.alert, without including the name window, so calling alert ('abc') would be correct .
The window objetc represents the window in which the HTML document containing the JavaScript code currently being executed is open.
The alert, confirm, and prompt methods display information in modal windows that block access to the page until they are closed.
The alert, confirm, and prompt metods require an argument specifying the position of the dialog box in which the information will be displayed.
